summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Interlochen Center for the Arts, requesting records of donations, tuition payments, and visits by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The document includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure and a declaration form for the custodian of records.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in the subpoena as an individual whose financial contributions and visits to Interlochen Center for the Arts are being investigated.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named in the subpoena alongside Jeffrey Epstein as an individual whose financial contributions and visits to Interlochen Center for the Arts are being investigated.

connections.description: Both are named together as subjects of the same grand jury investigation regarding financial contributions and visits to Interlochen Center for the Arts.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the grand jury investigation targeting Epstein.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the grand jury investigation targeting Maxwell.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which Interlochen Center for the Arts was commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts, 4000 Highway M-137, Interlochen, MI 49643
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was investigating potential violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a), which relates to transportation of minors for criminal sexual activity.
The subpoena sought all records of donations, tuition payments, and visits by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell to Interlochen Center for the Arts.
The government explicitly requested the recipient not disclose the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document indicates an active federal grand jury investigation into Epstein and Maxwell was ongoing as of February 2020.
The subpoena allowed for the production of records in lieu of a personal appearance if delivered to the FBI at 26 Federal Plaza by the return date.
